intro: Argostemma distichum subsp. distichum, commonly known as the two-ranked argostemma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, linear leaves that are often arranged in two ranks along the stem. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
